intro: Heptapleurum capitatum, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or golden thread, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a smooth or slightly serrated edge. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and is popular as a ornamental plant in gardens and indoor spaces.
